outputs.output_descr: The judicial  system resolve disputes at the formal and community level according to   legislated and  customary laws  and  recognized  socially defined values in South Sudan. The share volume of cases emanating from  such practices in post-independent South Sudan  requires  strengthened capacity  and understanding of  judicial officers and  court clerks in handling administrative procedures and management of court files  and cases. The project will  aim at providing training support to  judges and Legal Officers/ on best method of judicial administration such as case management, court room management and writing enforceable court orders.

donor_name: UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT FUND FOR WOME
DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND INTERNATIONAL TRADE (DFAIT) GOVERMENT OF CANADA
outputs.output_descr: As the institution responsible for the provision of  prosecutorial services  on behalf of the government and in certain cases for  accused defender in the form of public defender( Capital Crimes), The MOJ plays an important in sustaining a society of rule of law. UNDP  support will focus on increasing the capacity of Legal Officers/Prosecutors of the MoJ  on using various techniques of trial advocacy such as examination and cross-examination, impeaching witnesses, admitting exhibits, opening statements and closing arguments.  The training will also focus on using human rights approaches in justice administration. Training of  judges and Legal Officers/Prosecutors of the MoJ on various human rights instrument available at national, regional and international levels relevant to justice administration in South Sudan

donor_name: UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT FUND FOR WOME
outputs.output_descr: Majority of the rank and file of South Sudan Police Service are ex-combatants from SPLA who have been transferred into the Police.  The project aimed at establishing Police Service in South Sudan with a professional civilian orientation by using a multi-disciplinary approach and by supporting the process of putting in place legal regulatory frameworks to facilitate the transition from military to civilian modes of policing. Main areas of activities are Institutional/ organizational capacity development; Supporting infrastructure development; and supporting the designing of relevant strategic policy frameworks to facilitate development of the police institution; and Capacity Development to ensure the physical and professional ability to ensure the safety and security of the people of South Sudan.

Majority of the rank and file of South Sudan Prisons Service are ex-combatants from SPLA who have been transferred into the Prisons.  The project aimed at establishing Prisons Service in South Sudan with international minimum standards for treatment to prisoners by supporting the process of putting in place legal regulatory frameworks to facilitate the transition from military to civilian prisons service. Main areas of activities are Institutional/ organizational capacity development; Supporting adequate inmate and administration infrastructure; supporting the designing of relevant strategic policy frameworks; and Capacity Development to ensure the physical and professional ability and strengthened prison management.

outputs.output_descr: The overall expected outcome of the A2J programme is an increase in access to justice, and strengthened rule of law through equitable, accountable and effective service delivery through justice sector institutions and customary mechanisms.  The programme will aim at increasing  the capacity of case disposal rates of Judiciary of South Sudan; Increasing capacity of Ministry of Justice to deliver prosecutorial services at State and County level; enhancing South Sudan Police Service ability to maintain law and order; reducing arbitrarily (arbitrary) and unlawfully (unlawful) detention and decreasing violations of juvenile rights;

project_descr: Institutional and technical support to the justice sector to facilitate provision of equitable access to justice, and promote the law and order through accountable and transparent formal and informal institutions.
project_title: 4.3. Support to Access to Justice and Rule of Law
